column4: I have a machine that won't boot...the system BIOS was complaining about "no boot device found" but if I manually selected the hard drive, it would boot. I did a boot-repair from a live cd and not when I celect the drive manually I get "missing operating system"--anybody have any ideas?  http://paste.ubuntu.com/946105/
most likely it's the bios settings, not set to the right drive
It's an Intel with a G620 proc...series 6 chipset. Forget exactly what model but I wanna say DG61
